thread.section_title: Retail News - Wall Street Journal - Wsj.com
thread.title: Mexican Retailers Plan to Step Up Investment in 2018

author: Anthony Harrup
title: Mexican Retailers Plan to Step Up Investment in 2018
text:
MEXICO CITY--Mexican retailers plan to increase their investments to build new stores and remodel others in 2018, supported by expectations that sales growth will pick up moderately after a slowdown in 2017, an industry group said Tuesday.
Members of the retail association Antad, who operate more than 53,000 stores, plan to invest $3.1 billion this year, up from an estimated $2.8 billion in 2017, the group’s president Vicente Yáñez said. Close to 70% of the total will be invested in new stores and upgrades, and the balance... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
